summary: A yarmulke  or Kippah  is a small cloth cap worn by Jews.
full_text: A kippah, kippa, kipoh, or kipa , also known as a yarmulke , and sometimes called a koppel , is a brimless cap, usually made of cloth, worn by Jews to fulfil the customary requirement held by orthodox halachic authorities that the head be covered at all times. It is usually worn by men and, less frequently, by women  at times of prayer. In the United States of America, most synagogues and Jewish funeral services keep a ready supply of kipot for the temporary use of visitors who have not brought a kippah.
title: Kippah
